post.summary: CheckSlpTransaction checks the SLP validity of an unbroadcasted transaction.

GetAddressTransactions returns the transactions for the given address. Offers offset,
limit, and from block options.
post.description:
**Requires AddressIndex**
**Requires SlpIndex for slp related information **

post.summary:
GetAddressUnspentOutputs returns all the unspent transaction outputs
for the given address.
post.description:
**Requires AddressIndex**
**Requires SlpIndex for slp related information **

post.summary:
GetBip44HdAddress returns an address associated with a provided xpub, address index, and
selecting either internal or external by setting the change boolean.  If SlpIndex is disabled
the slpAddress string will be an empty string.
GetBlock returns detailed data for a block.
GetBlockFilter returns the compact filter (cf) of a block as a Golomb-Rice encoded set.

GetHeaders takes a block locator object and returns a batch of no more than 2000
headers. Upon parsing the block locator, if the server concludes there has been a
fork, it will send headers starting at the fork point, or genesis if no blocks in
the locator are in the best chain. If the locator is already at the tip no headers
will be returned.
see: bchd/bchrpc/documentation/wallet_operation.md
GetBlockInfo returns metadata and info for a specified block.

GetBlockchainInfo returns data about the blockchain including the most recent
block hash and height.

GetMempool returns information about all transactions currently in the memory pool.
Offers an option to return full transactions or just transactions hashes.
GetMempoolInfo returns the state of the current mempool.

GetMerkleProof returns a Merkle (SPV) proof for a specific transaction
in the provided block.

GetParsedSlpScript returns marshalled object from parsing an SLP pubKeyScript 
using goslp package.  This endpoint does not require SlpIndex.

GetRawAddressTransactions the serialized raw transactions for
the given address. Offers offset, limit, and from block options.
GetRawBlock returns a block in a serialized format.
GetRawTransaction returns a serialized transaction given a transaction hash.
GetTokenMetadata return SLP token metadata for one or more tokens.
GetTransaction returns a transaction given a transaction hash.
post.description:
**Requires TxIndex**
**Requires SlpIndex for slp related information **

post.summary: GetTrustedValidation returns SLP validity related information for one or more transactions.

GetUnspentOutput takes an unspent output in the utxo set and returns
the utxo metadata or not found.
Submit a transaction to all connected peers.

SubscribeBlocks creates a subscription for notifications of new blocks being
connected to the blockchain or blocks being disconnected.

SubscribeTransactionStream subscribes to relevant transactions based on
the subscription requests. The parameters to filter transactions on can
be updated by sending new SubscribeTransactionsRequest objects on the stream.
post.description:
NOTE: Because this RPC is using bi-directional streaming it cannot be used with
grpc-web.

**Requires TxIndex to receive input metadata**

post.summary:
SubscribeTransactions creates subscription to all relevant transactions based on
the subscription filter.
post.description:
This RPC does not use bidirectional streams and therefore can be used
with grpc-web. You will need to close and reopen the stream whenever
you want to update the subscription filter. If you are not using grpc-web
then SubscribeTransactionStream is more appropriate.

**Requires TxIndex to receive input metadata**
**Requires SlpIndex to receive slp input/output metadata, or TokenMetadata**

GetBlockchainInfoResponseBitcoinNet.description:
- MAINNET: Live public network with monetary value.
 - REGTEST: An isolated environment for automated testing.
 - TESTNET3: A public environment where monetary value is agreed to be zero,
and some checks for transaction conformity are disabled.
 - SIMNET: Private testnets for large scale simulations (or stress testing),
where a specified list of nodes is used, rather than node discovery.
GetBlockchainInfoResponseBitcoinNet.title: Bitcoin network types

hash.title: The hash of the transaction containing the output to be spent, little-endian

index.description: The index of specific output on the transaction.
The number of the input, starting from zero.

signature_script.title:
An unlocking script asserting a transaction is permitted to spend
the Outpoint (UTXO)

sequence.description:
As of BIP-68, the sequence number is interpreted as a relative
lock-time for the input.

previous_script.description: The pubkey_script of the previous output that is being spent.

address.description: The bitcoin addresses associated with this input.

index.description: The number of the output, starting from zero.

value.description: The number of satoshis to be transferred.

pubkey_script.description: The public key script used to pay coins.

address.description: The bitcoin addresses associated with this output.

disassembled_script.description: The script expressed in Bitcoin Cash Script.

info.description: Block header data, as well as metadata stored by the node.

transaction_data.description: List of transactions or transaction hashes.

hash.title:
The double sha256 hash of the six header fields in the first 80 bytes
of the block, when encoded according the bitcoin protocol, little-endian.
sha256(sha256(encoded_header))

height.description: The block number, an incremental index for each block mined.

version.description: A version number to track software/protocol upgrades.

previous_block.description: Hash of the previous block, little-endian.

merkle_root.description: The root of the Merkle Tree built from all transactions in the block, little-endian.

timestamp.description: When mining of the block started, expressed in seconds since 1970-01-01.

nonce.description:
A random value that was generated during block mining which happened to
result in a computed block hash below the difficulty target at the time.

confirmations.description: Number of blocks in a chain, including the block itself upon creation.

difficulty.description: Difficulty target at time of creation.

next_block_hash.description: Hash of the next block in this chain, little-endian.

size.description: Size of the block in bytes.

median_time.description: The median block time of the latest 11 block timestamps.

pbBlockInfo.title: Metadata for identifying and validating a block

type.description: Whether the block is connected to the chain.

block_info.description: Marshaled block header data, as well as metadata stored by the node.

serialized_block.description: Binary block, serialized using bitcoin protocol encoding.

pbBlockNotificationType.description: State of the block in relation to the chain.

address.description:
The address to query transactions, in lowercase cashaddr format.
The network prefix is optional (i.e. "cashaddress:").

nb_skip.description:
The number of confirmed transactions to skip, starting with the oldest first.
Does not affect results of unconfirmed transactions.

nb_fetch.description: Specify the number of transactions to fetch.

hash.description:
Recommended. Only get transactions after (or within) a
starting block identified by hash, little-endian.

height.description:
Recommended. Only get transactions after (or within) a
starting block identified by block number.

pbGetAddressTransactionsRequest.description:
Get marshaled transactions related to a specific address.

RECOMMENDED:
Parameters have been provided to query without creating
  performance issues on the node or client.

- The number of transactions to skip and fetch allow for iterating
      over a large set of transactions, if necessary.

- A starting block parameter (either `hash` or `height`)
      may then be used to filter results to those occurring
      after a certain time.

This approach will reduce network traffic and response processing
  for the client, as well as reduce workload on the node.

confirmed_transactions.description: Transactions that have been included in a block.

unconfirmed_transactions.description: Transactions in mempool which have not been included in a block.

address.description:
The address to query transactions, in lowercase cashaddr format.
The network identifier is optional (i.e. "cashaddress:").

include_mempool.description:
When `include_mempool` is true, unconfirmed transactions from mempool
are returned. Default is false.

hash.description: The block hash as a byte array or base64 encoded string, little-endian.

filter.description:
A compact filter matching input outpoints and public key scripts contained
in a block (encoded according to BIP158).

hash.description: The block hash as a byte array or base64 encoded string, little-endian.

info.description: Marshaled block header data, as well as metadata.

hash.description: The block hash as a byte array or base64 encoded string, little-endian.

full_transactions.description:
When `full_transactions` is true, full transactions are returned
instead of just hashes. Default is false.

bitcoin_net.description: Which network the node is operating on.

best_height.description: The current number of blocks on the longest chain.

best_block_hash.description: The hash of the best (tip) block in the most-work fully-validated chain, little-endian.

median_time.description: Median time of the last 11 blocks.

tx_index.description: When `tx_index` is true, the node has full transaction index enabled.

addr_index.description:
When `addr_index` is true, the node has address index enabled and may
be used with call related by address.

block_locator_hashes.description:
A list of block hashes known to the client (most recent first) which
is exponentially sparser toward the genesis block (0), little-endian.
Common practice is to include all of the last 10 blocks, and then
9 blocks for each order of ten thereafter.

stop_hash.description:
hash of the latest desired block header, little-endian; only blocks
occurring before the stop will be returned.

pbGetHeadersRequest.description: Request headers using a list of known block hashes.

size.title: The count of transactions in the mempool

bytes.title: The size in bytes of all transactions in the mempool

full_transactions.description:
When `full_transactions` is true, full transaction data is provided
instead of just transaction hashes. Default is false.

block.title: Block header information for the corresponding transaction

hashes.title:
A list containing the transaction hash, the adjacent leaf transaction hash
and the hashes of the highest nodes in the merkle tree not built with the transaction.
Proof hashes are ordered following transaction order, or left to right on the merkle tree

flags.description:
Binary representing the location of the matching transaction in the full merkle tree,
starting with the root (`1`) at position/level 0, where `1` corresponds
to a left branch and `01` is a right branch.

address.description:
The address to query transactions, in lowercase cashaddr format.
The network prefix is optional (i.e. "cashaddress:").

nb_skip.description:
The number of confirmed transactions to skip, starting with the oldest first.
Does not affect results of unconfirmed transactions.

nb_fetch.description: Specify the number of transactions to fetch.

hash.description:
Recommended. Only return transactions after some starting block
identified by hash, little-endian.

height.description:
Recommended. Only return transactions after some starting block
identified by block number.

pbGetRawAddressTransactionsRequest.description:
Get encoded transactions related to a specific address.

RECOMMENDED:
Parameters have been provided to query without creating
  performance issues on the node or client.

- The number of transactions to skip and fetch allow for iterating
      over a large set of transactions, if necessary.

- A starting block parameter (either `hash` or `height`)
      may then be used to filter results to those occurring
      after a certain time.

This approach will reduce network traffic and response processing
  for the client, as well as reduce workload on the node.

confirmed_transactions.description: Transactions that have been included in a block.

unconfirmed_transactions.description: Transactions in mempool which have not been included in a block.

hash.description: The block hash as a byte array or base64 encoded string, little-endian.

block.description: Raw block data (with header) serialized according the the bitcoin block protocol.

pbGetRawTransactionRequest.description: Get an encoded transaction from a transaction hash.

pbGetTransactionRequest.description: Get a transaction from a transaction hash.

hash.description: The hash of the transaction, little-endian.

index.description: The number of the output, starting from zero.

include_mempool.description:
When include_mempool is true, unconfirmed transactions from mempool
are returned. Default is false.

outpoint.description: A reference to the related input.

pubkey_script.title: Locking script dictating how funds can be spent in the future

is_coinbase.title:
When is_coinbase is true, the transaction was the first in a block,
created by a miner, and used to pay the block reward

block_height.description: The index number of the block containing the transaction creating the output.

added_time.description: The time when the transaction was added too the pool.

added_height.description: The block height when the transaction was added to the pool.

fee.description: The total fee in satoshi the transaction pays.

fee_per_kb.description: The fee in satoshi per kilobyte the transaction pays.

starting_priority.description: The priority of the transaction when it was added to the pool.

pbSlpAction.description:
SlpAction is used to allow clients to identify the type of slp transaction from this single field.

NOTE: All enum types except for "NON_SLP" may be annotated with one or more BurnFlags.

pbSlpNft1ChildGenesisMetadata.title: SlpNft1ChildGenesisMetadata is used to marshal NFT1 Child GENESIS OP_RETURN scriptPubKey

pbSlpNft1ChildSendMetadata.title: SlpNft1ChildSendMetadata is used to marshal NFT1 Child SEND OP_RETURN scriptPubKey

pbSlpRequiredBurn.title: SlpRequiredBurn is used by clients to allow token burning

pbSlpToken.description:
WARNING: Some languages (e.g., JavaScript) may not properly handle the 'uint64'
for large amounts. For this reason, an annotation has been added for JS to
return a string for the amount field instead of casting uint64 to the JS 'number'
type. Other languages may require similar treatment.
pbSlpToken.title: SlpToken info used in transaction inputs / outputs

pbSlpTransactionInfo.description: SlpTransactionInfo is used inside the Transaction message type.

pbSlpV1GenesisMetadata.title: SlpV1GenesisMetadata is used to marshal type 1 and NFT1 Group GENESIS OP_RETURN scriptPubKey

pbSlpV1MintMetadata.title: SlpV1MintMetadata is used to marshal type 1 MINT OP_RETURN scriptPubKey

pbSlpV1SendMetadata.title: SlpV1SendMetadata is used to marshal type 1 and NFT1 Group SEND OP_RETURN scriptPubKey

full_block.description:
When full_block is true, a complete marshaled block is sent. See `Block`.
Default is false, block metadata is sent. See `BlockInfo`.

full_transactions.description:
When full_transactions is true, provide full transaction info
for a marshaled block.
Default is false, only the transaction hashes are included for
a marshaled block. See `TransactionData`.

serialize_block.title:
When serialize_block is true, blocks are serialized using bitcoin protocol encoding.
Default is false, block will be Marshaled (see `BlockInfo` and `BlockNotification`)

pbSubscribeBlocksRequest.title: Options to define data structure to be sent by SubscribeBlock stream:

subscribe.title: Subscribe to a filter. add items to a filter

unsubscribe.title: Unsubscribe to a filter, remove items from a filter

include_mempool.description:
When include_mempool is true, new unconfirmed transactions from mempool are
included apart from the ones confirmed in a block.

include_in_block.description:
When include_in_block is true, transactions are included when they are confirmed.
This notification is sent in addition to any requested mempool notifications.

serialize_tx.title:
When serialize_tx is true, transactions are serialized using
bitcoin protocol encoding. Default is false, transaction will be Marshaled
(see `Transaction`, `MempoolTransaction` and `TransactionNotification`)

pbSubscribeTransactionsRequest.description: Request to subscribe or unsubscribe from a stream of transactions.

pbTokenMetadata.title: TokenMetadata is used to marshal metadata about a specific TokenID

pbTokenMetadataNFT1Child.description: NOTE: group id cannot be populated until the transaction has been confirmed
pbTokenMetadataNFT1Child.title: TokenMetadataNFT1Child is used to marshal metadata specific to NFT1 Child token IDs

pbTokenMetadataNFT1Group.description: NOTE: mint baton txid/vout cannot be populated until the transaction has been confirmed
pbTokenMetadataNFT1Group.title: TokenMetadataNFT1Group is used to marshal metadata specific to NFT1 Group token IDs

pbTokenMetadataTokenType1.description: NOTE: mint baton txid/vout cannot be populated until the transaction has been confirmed
pbTokenMetadataTokenType1.title: TokenMetadataTokenType1 is used to marshal metadata specific to Type 1 token IDs

hash.title:
The double sha256 hash of the encoded transaction, little-endian.
sha256(sha256(encoded_transaction))

version.description: The version of the transaction format.

lock_time.description:
The block height or timestamp after which this transaction is allowed.
If value is greater than 500 million, it is assumed to be an epoch timestamp,
otherwise it is treated as a block-height. Default is zero, or lock.

size.description: The size of the transaction in bytes.

timestamp.description: When the transaction was included in a block, in epoch time.

confirmations.description:
Number of blocks including proof of the transaction, including
the block it appeared.

block_height.description: Number of the block containing the transaction.

block_hash.description: Hash of the block the transaction was recorded in, little-endian.

outpoints.description: Filter by output hash and index.

data_elements.description: Filter by data elements contained in pubkey scripts.

all_transactions.description:
Subscribed/Unsubscribe to everything. Other filters
will be ignored.

all_slp_transactions.title:
Subscribed/Unsubscribe to everything SLP. Other filters
will be ignored, except this filter will be overriden by all_transactions=true

slp_token_ids.title: only transactions associated with the included tokenIds

type.description: Whether or not the transaction has been included in a block.

confirmed_transaction.description: A transaction included in a block.

serialized_transaction.description: Binary transaction, serialized using bitcoin protocol encoding.

pbTransactionNotificationType.description:
State of the transaction acceptance.

 - UNCONFIRMED: A transaction in mempool.
 - CONFIRMED: A transaction in a block.

outpoint.description: A reference to the output given by transaction hash and index.

pubkey_script.description: The public key script used to pay coins.

is_coinbase.description:
When is_coinbase is true, the output is the first in the block,
a generation transaction, the result of mining.

block_height.description: The block number containing the UXTO.
